burlap.behavior.valuefunction

Class QProvider.Helper

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.valuefunction.QProvider.Helper
  • Enclosing interface:
    QProvider

    public static class QProvider.Helper
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of helper static methods that may be commonly used by code that uses a QFunction instance. In particular, methods for computing the value function of a state, given the Q-values (the max Q-value or policy weighted value).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double maxQ(QProvider qSource, State s)
      Returns the optimal state value function for a state given a QProvider.
      static double policyValue(QProvider qSource, State s, EnumerablePolicy p)
      Returns the state value under a given policy for a state and QProvider.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • maxQ

        public static double maxQ(QProvider qSource,
                          State s)
        Returns the optimal state value function for a state given a QProvider. The optimal value is the max Q-value. If no actions are permissible in the input state, then zero is returned.
        Parameters:
        qSource - the QProvider capable of producing Q-values.
        s - the query State for which the value should be returned.
        Returns:
        the max Q-value for all possible Q-values in the state.

      • policyValue

        public static double policyValue(QProvider qSource,
                                 State s,
                                 EnumerablePolicy p)
        Returns the state value under a given policy for a state and QProvider. The value is the expected Q-value under the input policy action distribution. If no actions are permissible in the input state, then zero is returned.
        Parameters:
        qSource - the QProvider capable of producing Q-values.
        s - the query State for which the value should be returned.
        p - the policy defining the action distribution.
        Returns:
        the expected Q-value under the input policy action distribution
